info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 2:46PM EDT until August 07 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MADISON...NORTHWESTERN MITCHELL AND NORTHERN YANCEY COUNTIES... At 246 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Johnson City to 5 miles southeast of Erwin to 11 miles northeast of Marshall, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs, Buladean, Ramseytown, Faust, Allenstand, Walnut, Wolf Ridge, Poplar, Green Mountain and Swiss. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for western North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
